text: A song of ascents. Of David.\f + \fr Ps 131 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
My heart is not haughty nor my eyes ⸤arrogant⸥.\f + \fr 131:1 \ft Literally “raised” \f*
And I do not ⸤concern myself⸥\f + \fr 131:1 \ft Literally “walk about” \f*
with things too great and difficult for me.
Rather I have soothed and quieted my soul,
like a weaned child with its mother,
like the weaned child \add is\add* my soul with me.
